abstract: Microsoft, taking aim at the world's fastest-growing smartphone market, said on Monday that it would team up with Huawei of China to sell a low-cost Windows smartphone in Africa, reports Kevin J. O'Brien in Tuesday's New York Times. The phone, called the Huawei 4Afrika Windows Phone, will cost $150 and initially be sold in seven countries.
